author: Suzy Bennett
title: Flear Farm Cottages, South Devon: review
text: Telegraph expert rating: 9/10 Flear Farm Cottages is a collection of 11 family-friendly cottages and converted barns, plus a large Georgian house, set in a lushly-wooded 30-acre valley in South Devon, where guests can wander through streamside meadows, apple orchards and paddocks. Geared towards families with young children, facilities rival those of any large hotel, and include an indoor pool, tennis court, trampoline, pitch-and-putt golf and an indoor play barn. The idyllic South Devon countryside location, which is also close to the county’s safest, sandiest beaches, is hard to beat. Location: 9/10 Set in a private, secluded valley of flower-filled meadows, paddocks, apple orchards, streams and native woodlands, Flear Farm offers old-fashioned, back-to-nature holidays in a prime South Devon location. With the county’s finest sandy beaches just a 20-minute drive away, and the harbour towns of Salcombe and Dartmouth nearby, there’s the opportunity to enjoy coast as well as country. Style & character: 7/10 A convivial, homespun atmosphere is set by the friendly owners, Barney and Camilla, who live on-site and have two young children. Fear Farm has a convivial, homespun atmosphere The 11 airy oak-framed barns and cottages named after their original uses – The Diary, The Hay Loft, The Cow Shed - are simply and tastefully furnished, and most come with wood-burning stoves, modern, well-equipped kitchens, flat-screen televisions and terraces or gardens. Thoughtful touches include blackout blinds, stair gates and toy baskets. Flear House sleeps 10, so is popular with extended families. The estate is run largely on renewable energy, making it a low-impact, guilt-free holiday for environmentally-minded visitors. Facilities: 10/10 Tuned in to the needs of young families, the big-hearted owners provide the kind of facilities usually only found in a large resort hotel. There’s an indoor 40-ft pool heated to a baby-friendly 30C, an outdoor hot tub, sauna, huge indoor play barn with table football and snooker for adults, a trampoline, pitch-and-putt golf, daily pony feeding in the paddock, picnic lawn, fishing pond and tennis court. There’s complimentary use of buckets and spades, windbreaks, footballs and rugby balls, golf clubs, tennis rackets, body boards, parasols and shrimping nets, and a huge film library. Flear Farm Cottages: a shared indoor pool is one of many things to keep children busy here Toddler swimming lessons are held weekly, and tennis lessons and in-house beauty treatments can be arranged. Child-minding and baby-sitting services, travel cots, baby monitors and baby baths are all available. Value for money: 8/10 Cottage from £655 per week in low season; rising to £1294 in high. Free wi-fi. Eating Many guests order a supermarket delivery for their arrival, but if you’d prefer more local fare, oven-ready meals and organic farm boxes from nearby Riverford Farm are available to order. Barney has plans to open an honesty shop on site selling deli-style food and pre-prepared meals. The Fortescue Arms, a child-friendly gastro-pub, is a mile’s walk or short drive away in the pretty village East Allington, and the visitors’ guide includes a comprehensive list of other child-friendly local restaurants. Access for guests with disabilities One cottage, The Stables, has a wheelchair-access bedroom and bathroom. Details East Allington, Totnes TQ9 7RF 01548 521227 www.flearfarmcottages.com Telegraphtravel Follow @telegraphtravel
